faqs.question: What is a Life Path Number?
faqs.answer: Your Life Path Number is the most important number in Numerology. It reveals your life's purpose, natural talents, and the challenges you may face. It's calculated by reducing your birth date to a single digit (or master number).

faqs.question: How is the Life Path Number calculated?
faqs.answer: Add all digits of your birth date (day + month + year), then reduce to a single digit. For example, if born on 15/08/1990: 1+5+0+8+1+9+9+0 = 33 ‚Üí 3+3 = 6. Master numbers (11, 22, 33) are not reduced.

faqs.question: What are Master Numbers?
faqs.answer: Master Numbers are 11, 22, and 33. These are considered powerful vibrations and are not reduced to single digits. They indicate heightened spiritual purpose and greater potential‚Äîalong with greater challenges.

faqs.question: Can my Life Path Number change?
faqs.answer: No, your Life Path Number is fixed based on your birth date. However, your understanding and expression of its energy can evolve as you grow and develop throughout life.

faqs.question: Which Life Path Numbers are most compatible?
faqs.answer: Compatibility depends on the specific numbers. Generally, 1 pairs well with 3, 5, 9; 2 with 4, 6, 8; 3 with 1, 5, 9. Master numbers (11, 22, 33) often connect with spiritually-aware partners. Use our Love Compatibility Numerology Calculator for detailed analysis.

faqs.question: How does Life Path Number affect career and money?
faqs.answer: Your Life Path Number reveals your natural strengths and ideal work environment. For example, Life Path 1 thrives in leadership roles, 4 excels in structured careers, 8 is drawn to business and finance. Check your number's detailed interpretation above for career guidance.

educational.title: What is Life Path Number?
content: The Life Path Number is the most important number in numerology. Derived from your complete date of birth, it reveals your life's purpose, natural talents, and the challenges you'll face on your journey. Think of it as a roadmap for your entire life‚Äîa blueprint of who you are at your core.

In numerology, we calculate the Life Path Number by reducing your birth date (day + month + year) to a single digit, except for Master Numbers 11, 22, and 33, which carry special spiritual significance and are not reduced further.
Enter your birth date above to discover your Life Path Number and unlock detailed insights about your personality, ideal careers, love compatibility, and life phases.

faqs.question: What is Chaldean Numerology?
faqs.answer: Chaldean Numerology is one of the oldest numerology systems, originating from ancient Babylon. It assigns numbers 1-8 to letters (9 is considered sacred). It's considered more accurate than the Pythagorean system by many practitioners.

faqs.question: How does Chaldean differ from Pythagorean?
faqs.answer: Chaldean assigns numbers based on sound vibrations, while Pythagorean uses alphabetical sequence. Chaldean uses 1-8 (9 is sacred), while Pythagorean uses 1-9. Chaldean is often considered more mystically accurate.

faqs.question: Which name should I use?
faqs.answer: Use the name you're most commonly called by. This could be your first name, full name, or nickname. You can check multiple variations to see which carries the most favorable vibration.

faqs.question: Is Chaldean numerology more accurate than other systems?
faqs.answer: Many numerologists consider Chaldean more accurate because it's based on sound vibrations rather than alphabetical order. It's the original system used by ancient Babylonian mystics for divination and prophecy.

faqs.question: What if my name number is unlucky?
faqs.answer: An unfavorable name number doesn't mean bad luck. You can use our Name Correction tool to find small spelling changes that improve your name's vibration while keeping it recognizable.

faqs.question: Can I calculate my business name using Chaldean?
faqs.answer: Yes! Chaldean numerology is excellent for analyzing business names. Check our Business Name Numerology Calculator for comprehensive brand energy analysis with industry-specific guidance.

educational.title: What is Chaldean Numerology?
content: Chaldean Numerology is the oldest form of numerology, developed by the ancient Babylonians over 4,000 years ago. Unlike the more common Pythagorean system, Chaldean numerology assigns values 1-8 to letters based on their sound vibrations, with 9 held sacred and never assigned to a letter.

This system is considered by many practitioners to be more accurate and mystically profound because it connects letters to their vibrational energy rather than their alphabetical position. The Chaldeans believed that numbers held the key to understanding the universe's hidden patterns.
Enter your name above to discover your Chaldean Name Number and understand the vibrational energy your name carries every day.

faqs.question: What is the Lo Shu Grid?
faqs.answer: The Lo Shu Grid is an ancient Chinese 3x3 magic square discovered on a turtle's shell. Each position corresponds to a number 1-9. Your birth date numbers fill the grid, revealing strengths and weaknesses.

faqs.question: What do missing numbers mean?
faqs.answer: Missing numbers indicate areas of life that may need more attention or development. They're not necessarily negative‚Äîthey show where growth opportunities exist.

faqs.question: What are the arrows?
faqs.answer: Arrows form when three numbers in a row, column, or diagonal are all present (strength) or all missing (weakness). Each arrow has specific meanings related to personality traits and life areas.

faqs.question: How is the Lo Shu Grid calculated from my birth date?
faqs.answer: We take all digits from your birth date (DD/MM/YYYY) and place each digit in its corresponding position on the 3x3 grid. Repeated digits show strength in that area, while empty cells reveal missing energies.

faqs.question: Can I remedy missing numbers in my Lo Shu Grid?
faqs.answer: Yes! Traditional remedies include surrounding yourself with the missing number's energy through colors, gemstones, or using that number in your environment. Our analysis provides specific remedies for each missing number.

faqs.question: Is Lo Shu Grid connected to Feng Shui?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Lo Shu Grid is fundamental to Feng Shui. The same 3x3 grid maps to the Bagua, with each sector governing different life areas like wealth, relationships, and career.

educational.title: What is the Lo Shu Grid?
content: The Lo Shu Grid is an ancient Chinese numerology system dating back over 4,000 years. According to legend, the pattern was discovered on the shell of a divine turtle that emerged from the Luo River. This 3x3 magic square became the foundation for Chinese numerology, Feng Shui, and I-Ching divination.

Each position in the grid corresponds to a number 1-9, and your birth date numbers reveal which energies are strong (present or repeated) and which are missing in your life. The grid also reveals 'arrows' of strength or weakness when numbers align in rows, columns, or diagonals.
Enter your birth date above to generate your personal Lo Shu Grid and discover your innate strengths, areas for growth, and personalized remedies.

faqs.question: What is the Destiny Number?
faqs.answer: The Destiny Number (also called Expression Number) is calculated from your full birth name. It reveals your life's purpose, the talents you're meant to develop, and the goals you're destined to achieve.

faqs.question: How is the Destiny Number calculated?
faqs.answer: Each letter of your full birth name is assigned a number (A=1, B=2... I=9, J=1, etc.) using the Pythagorean system. All letter values are added together, then reduced to a single digit or master number (11, 22, 33).

faqs.question: Which name should I use?
faqs.answer: Use your full name as given at birth, including first, middle, and last names. This represents your original energy blueprint. You can also calculate with your current legal name to see how a name change affects your vibration.

faqs.question: How is this different from Life Path Number?
faqs.answer: Life Path Number is calculated from your birth date and shows your life journey. Destiny Number is calculated from your name and reveals your purpose and talents. Together they provide a complete picture of your numerological profile.

faqs.question: Can changing my name change my Destiny Number?
faqs.answer: Yes! When you change your name legally or start using a new name regularly, you create a new Destiny Number vibration. Many people adopt names with more favorable numbers to support their goals. Check our Name Correction tool for suggestions.

faqs.question: What if my Destiny and Life Path Numbers conflict?
faqs.answer: Different numbers create dynamic tension that can drive growth. For example, a Life Path 4 (stability) with Destiny 5 (change) must balance security with adventure. Understanding both helps you integrate these energies constructively.

educational.title: What is the Destiny Number?
content: The Destiny Number, also known as the Expression Number, is one of the core numbers in numerology. Calculated from the letters of your full birth name, it reveals your life's purpose, the talents you're meant to develop, and the ultimate goals you're destined to achieve.

Unlike your Life Path Number (derived from birth date), which shows your journey, the Destiny Number shows your destination‚Äîthe person you're becoming through life's experiences. It represents your potential and the qualities you need to express to fulfill your purpose.
Enter your full birth name above to discover your Destiny Number and understand the unique mission encoded in your name since birth.

faqs.question: How are lucky numbers calculated?
faqs.answer: Your lucky numbers are derived from your birth date using numerological principles. We calculate your Life Path Number, Birth Day Number, and Personal Year Number, then identify compatible numbers that harmonize with your core vibration.

faqs.question: What's the difference between primary and secondary lucky numbers?
faqs.answer: Primary lucky numbers (Life Path and Birth Day) are your most powerful numbers, directly tied to your birth. Secondary lucky numbers are compatible numbers that harmonize well with your primary numbers and bring supportive energy.

faqs.question: How should I use my lucky numbers?
faqs.answer: Use your lucky numbers when making important decisions - choosing dates, phone numbers, addresses, or even lottery numbers. They can also guide timing for meetings, travel, or starting new projects.

faqs.question: Why should I avoid certain numbers?
faqs.answer: Certain numbers create friction with your core vibration. While they're not necessarily 'bad,' they may bring extra challenges or require more effort. Being aware helps you prepare when these numbers are unavoidable.

faqs.question: Can lucky numbers help with lottery or gambling?
faqs.answer: While lucky numbers align with your personal vibration, gambling outcomes depend on many factors beyond numerology. Use your numbers as a guide, but always gamble responsibly and within your means.

faqs.question: Do lucky numbers change over time?
faqs.answer: Your core lucky numbers remain fixed, but your Personal Year Number changes annually, affecting which numbers are most favorable each year. Check the Personal Year section for current year guidance.

educational.title: What are Lucky Numbers?
content: In numerology, lucky numbers are specific digits that resonate harmoniously with your personal vibration, determined by your birth date. These numbers can influence outcomes in your favor when used consciously in daily decisions, important dates, and life choices.

Your primary lucky numbers come from your Life Path Number and Birth Day Number‚Äîthe two most influential numbers in your numerology chart. Secondary lucky numbers are those that naturally harmonize with your primaries, creating a supportive numerical environment.

info.title: About Name Correction in Numerology
info.description: In numerology, your name carries a specific vibration that influences your life. Small changes to spelling can shift this vibration to be more harmonious with your birth numbers, potentially attracting better opportunities and reducing obstacles.

howItWorks.title: How Name Correction Works
howItWorks.description: We analyze your current name using both Pythagorean (Western) and Chaldean (Ancient) systems. By comparing your name number with your Life Path and Birth Day numbers, we identify compatibility and suggest modifications like adding letters, doubling consonants, or changing vowels to achieve more favorable numbers.

systems.title: Two Numerology Systems
systems.description: Pythagorean numerology assigns values 1-9 alphabetically (A=1, B=2...). Chaldean numerology uses sound vibrations and considers 9 sacred (1-8 only). Both systems provide valuable insights, and we analyze your name in both for comprehensive suggestions.

faqs.question: How do small spelling changes affect my name's energy?
faqs.answer: Each letter has a numerical value. Adding, removing, or changing even one letter shifts the total, potentially moving you to a more compatible number. A silent 'H' at the start or doubling a vowel can make significant numerological differences while keeping your name recognizable.

faqs.question: Should I change my legal name or just how I write it?
faqs.answer: The most important name is the one you use daily - on signatures, social media, business cards. Many people use a numerologically optimized spelling without legally changing their name. However, for maximum effect, using the corrected spelling consistently is recommended.

faqs.question: What if my name is already compatible?
faqs.answer: If your name number already harmonizes with your birth numbers, you may not need changes. Our tool will show this as an 'Excellent' or 'Good' match. The suggestions provided would be for even stronger alignment if desired.

faqs.question: Can I test a name before using it?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Use our tool to analyze any name variation. Try different spellings, adding initials, or including/excluding your middle name to see which combination has the best numerological harmony with your birth date.

faqs.question: How long until I see results from a name change?
faqs.answer: Name vibrations work gradually. Most practitioners suggest consistently using your new spelling for at least 90 days before evaluating changes. The effects are subtle - you may notice shifts in how people perceive you, opportunities that arise, or your own mindset.

faqs.question: Which numerology system is better for name correction?
faqs.answer: We analyze using both Pythagorean (alphabetical) and Chaldean (vibrational) systems. Pythagorean is more common in the West, while Chaldean is considered more ancient and accurate. Our tool shows results from both so you can make an informed choice.

educational.title: What is Name Correction Numerology?
content: Name Correction Numerology is the practice of optimizing your name's spelling to achieve a more favorable numerical vibration. Since each letter carries a specific numerical value, small changes‚Äîlike adding a silent letter or adjusting a vowel‚Äîcan shift your name number to one that harmonizes better with your birth numbers.

This ancient practice is based on the belief that your name creates a vibration you carry throughout life. When this vibration aligns with your core numbers (Life Path and Birth Day), you experience less resistance and more natural flow in achieving your goals.
Enter your current name and birth date above to see your current compatibility score and get personalized suggestions for name optimization.

faqs.question: What makes a business name 'lucky'?
faqs.answer: A lucky business name has a number that harmonizes with the owner's Life Path and Birth Day numbers. It should also fit the industry's favorable numbers. The brand energy profile should align with your business goals - stability for banks, creativity for agencies, etc.

faqs.question: How do brand energy profiles work?

faqs.question: How are lucky colors determined?
faqs.answer: Lucky colors are determined by your Birth Day Number (the day you were born), which reveals your ruling planet. Each planet has specific color vibrations that resonate with it. We also consider your Life Path Number and Name Number for a comprehensive color profile.

faqs.question: Should I wear my lucky colors every day?
faqs.answer: You don't need to wear your lucky colors constantly. Use them strategically for important occasions, job interviews, presentations, or when you need extra support. Wearing them on your planetary day (like Sunday for number 1) amplifies their effect.

faqs.question: Why should I avoid certain colors?
faqs.answer: Colors to avoid are associated with planets that are naturally inimical to your ruling planet. While they won't cause harm, they may create subtle friction with your energy. It's best to avoid them for important events.

faqs.question: Can I use lucky colors in home decor?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Using your lucky colors in home decor creates a harmonious environment. Paint walls, choose curtains, or add accessories in your lucky colors. This creates continuous positive vibrations in your living space.

faqs.question: What if my lucky color doesn't suit my skin tone?
faqs.answer: You don't need to wear the exact shade. Any variation of your lucky color family works - lighter or darker tones, or complementary shades. You can also use the colors in accessories, jewelry, or items you carry.

faqs.question: Are lucky colors connected to chakras?
faqs.answer: Yes, there's a connection between numerology colors and chakra energies. For example, red (Mars/9) relates to the root chakra, orange (Sun/1) to the sacral, and violet (Ketu/7) to the crown. Wearing these colors can support both numerological and chakra balance.

faqs.question: How should I prepare for my Bhagyodaya year?

faqs.question: What is Moon Sign (Chandra Rashi)?
faqs.answer: In Vedic astrology, your Moon Sign (Chandra Rashi) is the zodiac sign where the Moon was positioned at your birth. Unlike Western astrology which focuses on Sun Sign, Vedic astrology considers Moon Sign as more important because it governs your mind, emotions, and subconscious patterns.

faqs.question: Why is Moon Sign important?
faqs.answer: The Moon represents your mind (Manas) in Vedic astrology. Your Moon Sign determines your emotional responses, instincts, habits, and how you nurture yourself and others. It's used for calculating Dasha periods, compatibility matching, and daily predictions.

faqs.question: How is Moon Sign different from Sun Sign?
faqs.answer: Sun Sign is based on your birth date and changes monthly. Moon Sign is based on exact birth time and place, changing every 2.5 days. In Vedic astrology, Moon Sign is primary for predictions, while Sun Sign shows your soul's purpose and ego.

faqs.question: Why do I need exact birth time?
faqs.answer: The Moon moves approximately 13 degrees per day through the zodiac. Even a few hours difference in birth time can change your Moon Sign. Accurate birth time ensures correct calculation of your Rashi and Nakshatra.

faqs.question: What is Nakshatra?
faqs.answer: Nakshatra is the lunar mansion or star constellation where your Moon is placed. There are 27 Nakshatras, each spanning 13¬∞20' of the zodiac. Your Nakshatra provides deeper insights into your personality and is essential for Dasha calculations.

faqs.question: Can I use Moon Sign for daily horoscope?
faqs.answer: Yes! In Vedic astrology, daily, weekly, and monthly predictions are based on Moon Sign, not Sun Sign. Transit planets' effects are read from the Moon's position, making Moon Sign more accurate for daily guidance.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Nakshatra and Rashi (Moon Sign)?
faqs.answer: Rashi (Moon Sign) is one of 12 zodiac signs spanning 30¬∞ each, while Nakshatra is one of 27 lunar mansions spanning 13¬∞20' each. Nakshatra provides more precise and detailed information about your personality. One Rashi contains 2.25 Nakshatras.

faqs.question: Why do I need exact birth time for Nakshatra?
faqs.answer: The Moon moves through all 27 Nakshatras in approximately 27 days, spending about one day in each Nakshatra. Even a few hours difference can change your Nakshatra, especially if you were born near a Nakshatra boundary (Gandanta points).

faqs.question: What is Vimshottari Dasha and how does Nakshatra affect it?
faqs.answer: Vimshottari Dasha is the 120-year planetary period system used in Vedic astrology. Your birth Nakshatra determines which planet's Mahadasha you start with and how much of it remains at birth. This is crucial for timing predictions.

faqs.question: How are auspicious name syllables determined?
faqs.answer: Each Pada of every Nakshatra is associated with specific syllables. Names starting with these syllables are considered auspicious as they align with your birth star's energy. This is commonly used when naming babies in Hindu tradition.

faqs.question: What are the 27 Nakshatras?
faqs.answer: The 27 Nakshatras are: Ashwini, Bharani, Krittika, Rohini, Mrigashira, Ardra, Punarvasu, Pushya, Ashlesha, Magha, Purva Phalguni, Uttara Phalguni, Hasta, Chitra, Swati, Vishakha, Anuradha, Jyeshtha, Mula, Purva Ashadha, Uttara Ashadha, Shravana, Dhanishta, Shatabhisha, Purva Bhadrapada, Uttara Bhadrapada, and Revati.

faqs.question: What is Gana in Nakshatra?
faqs.answer: Gana refers to temperament classification: Deva (divine/noble), Manushya (human/balanced), and Rakshasa (demonic/intense). It's important in marriage compatibility‚Äîsame Gana or compatible Ganas indicate harmony.

educational.title: What is Nakshatra (Birth Star)?

Each Nakshatra has a ruling deity, planet, symbol, animal sign, and associated qualities. They're divided into 4 Padas (quarters) of 3¬∞20' each, which determine auspicious name syllables and fine-tune personality analysis. Your Nakshatra also determines your Vimshottari Dasha starting planet.

faqs.question: How is Lagna different from Sun Sign?

about.title: What is Mahadasha?
about.description: Mahadasha is a planetary period system in Vedic Astrology. The most commonly used is Vimshottari Dasha, which spans 120 years divided among 9 planets. Each planet's period brings specific themes and influences based on that planet's nature.
about.importanceDescription: Mahadasha determines the major themes and events in different phases of your life. Understanding your current Dasha helps in timing important decisions, understanding ongoing challenges, and making the most of favorable periods.

faqs.question: What is Vimshottari Dasha?
faqs.answer: Vimshottari Dasha is a 120-year planetary period system based on the Moon's nakshatra at birth. It divides life into periods ruled by different planets: Sun (6 years), Moon (10 years), Mars (7 years), Rahu (18 years), Jupiter (16 years), Saturn (19 years), Mercury (17 years), Ketu (7 years), and Venus (20 years).

faqs.question: What is Antardasha?
faqs.answer: Antardasha is a sub-period within a Mahadasha. Each Mahadasha is divided into 9 Antardashas, one for each planet. The combined effect of Mahadasha and Antardasha lords determines the specific experiences during that time.

faqs.question: How does Mahadasha affect my life?
faqs.answer: The Mahadasha lord's natural significations and its placement in your birth chart determine the themes of that period. A well-placed planet gives positive results, while an afflicted planet may bring challenges related to its significations.

faqs.question: Can remedies change Mahadasha effects?
faqs.answer: Remedies like gemstones, mantras, charity, and worship can help mitigate negative effects and enhance positive ones. However, they work best when performed with faith and consistency. The fundamental karmic patterns remain, but their intensity can be modified.

faqs.question: Which is the best Mahadasha?
faqs.answer: There's no universally 'best' Mahadasha‚Äîit depends on the planet's placement in your specific chart. Generally, well-placed Jupiter and Venus periods are favorable, while Saturn and Rahu can be challenging but transformative. Your chart's specifics determine the experience.

faqs.question: How long does each Mahadasha last?
faqs.answer: Sun 6 years, Moon 10 years, Mars 7 years, Rahu 18 years, Jupiter 16 years, Saturn 19 years, Mercury 17 years, Ketu 7 years, Venus 20 years. The total 120 years covers the traditional human lifespan in Vedic thought.

educational.title: What is Mahadasha?
content: Mahadasha is the planetary period system in Vedic Astrology that divides your life into phases ruled by different planets. The most widely used is Vimshottari Dasha, a 120-year cycle divided among 9 planets (grahas). Each planet's period brings specific themes and life experiences based on that planet's nature and position in your birth chart.

Your birth Nakshatra determines which planet's Mahadasha you begin life in and how much of it remains at birth. This creates your unique timeline of planetary periods, which astrologers use for timing predictions about career, relationships, health, and other life events.
Enter your birth details above to see your complete Mahadasha timeline, current planetary period, and upcoming Dasha transitions.

faqs.question: What is a Kundli?
faqs.answer: Kundli (also called Janam Patri or Birth Chart) is a map of the sky at the exact moment of your birth. It shows the positions of the Sun, Moon, planets, and zodiac signs, which astrologers use to understand your personality, life path, and future events.

faqs.question: Why is accurate birth time important?
faqs.answer: The Lagna (Ascendant) changes approximately every 2 hours, and the Moon changes Nakshatra every day. Even a few minutes difference can change house placements and Dasha calculations. For accurate predictions, precise birth time is essential.

faqs.question: What are the houses in a Kundli?
faqs.answer: A Kundli has 12 houses, each representing different life areas: 1st (self), 2nd (wealth), 3rd (siblings), 4th (home), 5th (children), 6th (health), 7th (marriage), 8th (longevity), 9th (fortune), 10th (career), 11th (gains), and 12th (losses/moksha).

faqs.question: What planets are shown in a Kundli?
faqs.answer: A Vedic Kundli shows 9 planets (Navagrahas): Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, Rahu (North Node), and Ketu (South Node). Each planet's position by sign and house reveals different life influences.

faqs.question: What is the difference between North and South Indian chart styles?
faqs.answer: Both show the same information differently. North Indian charts have houses in fixed positions with signs rotating. South Indian charts have signs in fixed positions with houses rotating. The data and interpretation remain the same.

faqs.question: Can Kundli predict the future accurately?
faqs.answer: Kundli shows tendencies, potentials, and timing of events based on Dasha periods. It indicates probabilities rather than certainties. Free will and karma interact with planetary influences to shape actual outcomes.

educational.title: What is Kundli (Birth Chart)?
content: A Kundli, also known as Janam Patri or Birth Chart, is a map of the sky at the exact moment of your birth. It shows where each planet was positioned in the 12 zodiac signs and 12 houses, creating a unique blueprint that Vedic astrologers use to understand your personality, predict life events, and guide important decisions.

The Kundli contains three key components: your Lagna (Ascendant) which determines your personality and appearance, your Moon Sign which governs your mind and emotions, and the positions of all 9 Vedic planets which influence different life areas based on the houses they occupy.
Enter your birth details above to generate your complete Kundli with planetary positions, house placements, and current Dasha period.

faqs.question: What is Raj Yoga?
faqs.answer: Raj Yoga is a powerful planetary combination in Vedic astrology that indicates success, fame, authority, and prosperity. It is formed when benefic planets occupy specific houses or when the lords of certain houses combine in auspicious ways.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Raj Yoga?
faqs.answer: There are many types including Panch Mahapurusha Yogas (Hamsa, Malavya, Ruchaka, Bhadra, Shasha), Gaja Kesari Yoga (Jupiter-Moon combination), Budhaditya Yoga (Sun-Mercury conjunction), Lakshmi Yoga, Dhana Yoga, and various Kendra-Trikona Raj Yogas.

faqs.question: Does having Raj Yoga guarantee success?
faqs.answer: While Raj Yoga indicates strong potential for success, its manifestation depends on planetary strength, aspects, Dasha periods, and personal effort. A strong Raj Yoga activated during favorable Dasha periods brings the best results.

faqs.question: What is Gaja Kesari Yoga?
faqs.answer: Gaja Kesari Yoga forms when Jupiter is in a Kendra (1st, 4th, 7th, or 10th house) from the Moon. It bestows intelligence, wealth, good reputation, and leadership abilities. The strength depends on Jupiter's placement and aspects.

faqs.question: When will my Raj Yoga give results?
faqs.answer: Raj Yoga typically manifests during the Mahadasha or Antardasha of the planets forming the yoga. Check our Mahadasha Calculator to see when your yoga-forming planets' periods are active.

faqs.question: Can I enhance my Raj Yoga?
faqs.answer: Yes! Wearing gemstones of yoga-forming planets (after consultation), performing their mantras, and acting in alignment with the yoga's theme can strengthen its effects. Our tool provides specific enhancement remedies.

educational.title: What is Raj Yoga in Vedic Astrology?
content: Raj Yoga (meaning 'Royal Union') refers to powerful planetary combinations in Vedic astrology that indicate extraordinary success, fame, authority, and prosperity. When specific planets occupy favorable positions or lords of certain houses combine in auspicious ways, they create these success-giving yogas.

The most important Raj Yogas include Panch Mahapurusha Yogas (formed by Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn in Kendras), Gaja Kesari Yoga (Jupiter in Kendra from Moon), and various Kendra-Trikona Raj Yogas (lords of angular and trine houses combining).
Enter your birth details above to discover which Raj Yogas are present in your chart, their strength, and when they're likely to manifest.

faqs.question: What is Sade Sati?
faqs.answer: Sade Sati is the 7.5 year period when Saturn (Shani) transits through the 12th, 1st, and 2nd houses from your natal Moon sign. It's considered one of the most significant planetary transits in Vedic astrology.

faqs.question: Is Sade Sati always bad?
faqs.answer: Not necessarily. While Sade Sati brings challenges, it also teaches valuable life lessons and can lead to spiritual growth. The effects depend on Saturn's position and aspects in your birth chart. For some, it can even bring positive transformations.

faqs.question: How can I reduce the effects of Sade Sati?
faqs.answer: Traditional remedies include worshipping Lord Shani or Hanuman, chanting Shani mantras, observing Saturday fasts, donating black items, and wearing blue sapphire (only after proper consultation). Most importantly, maintaining discipline, patience, and karma yoga helps navigate this period.

faqs.question: What are the three phases of Sade Sati?
faqs.answer: Rising Phase (12th from Moon): Mental stress, confusion. Peak Phase (over Moon): Maximum pressure, transformation. Setting Phase (2nd from Moon): Financial concerns, gradual relief. Each phase lasts approximately 2.5 years.

faqs.question: How often does Sade Sati occur?
faqs.answer: Saturn takes about 29.5 years to complete one zodiac cycle, so most people experience Sade Sati 2-3 times in their lifetime. It typically first occurs in late 20s or early 30s.

faqs.question: Can Sade Sati be positive?
faqs.answer: Yes, if Saturn is well-placed in your birth chart (yogakaraka for Taurus/Libra ascendants, or in friendly signs), Sade Sati can bring career advancement, discipline, and material success alongside its challenges.

educational.title: What is Sade Sati?
content: Sade Sati (literally 'seven and a half' in Hindi) is the 7.5-year period when Saturn transits through the three signs around your Moon: the 12th house (2.5 years), 1st house over your Moon (2.5 years), and 2nd house (2.5 years). It's one of the most significant and discussed transits in Vedic astrology.

Saturn is the planet of karma, discipline, and lessons. During Sade Sati, Saturn's energy intensely affects your mind (Moon), bringing challenges that ultimately lead to growth, maturity, and karmic clearing. Effects vary greatly based on Saturn's natal position and your overall chart.
Enter your birth details above to check your current Sade Sati status, phase, and get personalized remedies.

faqs.question: What is Manglik Dosha?
faqs.answer: Manglik Dosha (also called Mangal Dosha or Kuja Dosha) occurs when Mars is placed in the 1st, 2nd, 4th, 7th, 8th, or 12th house from Lagna, Moon, or Venus. It is believed to cause challenges in marriage and relationships due to Mars's aggressive energy.

faqs.question: Can Manglik marry non-Manglik?
faqs.answer: Yes, a Manglik can marry a non-Manglik, especially if there are cancellation factors in the chart. Additionally, if the Manglik effect is mild or if proper remedies like Kumbh Vivah are performed, the marriage can be successful. Many astrologers also suggest that the effect diminishes after age 28.

faqs.question: How is Manglik Dosha cancelled?
faqs.answer: Manglik Dosha can be cancelled if: Mars is in its own sign (Aries/Scorpio), Mars is exalted in Capricorn, Jupiter aspects Mars, Venus is conjunct Mars, Mars is in certain signs in the 1st house (Aries, Leo, Scorpio, Capricorn, Aquarius), or both partners are Manglik.

faqs.question: What are the remedies for Manglik Dosha?
faqs.answer: Common remedies include: Kumbh Vivah (symbolic marriage to a pot/tree before actual marriage), wearing Red Coral gemstone, chanting Mangal mantras, Hanuman worship on Tuesdays, donating red items, and fasting on Tuesdays. Consult an astrologer for personalized remedies.

faqs.question: Does Manglik Dosha affect after age 28?
faqs.answer: Many astrologers believe Manglik Dosha effects diminish after age 28 as Mars energy matures. However, this varies by tradition‚Äîsome consider it lifelong while others say it applies mainly to first marriages.

faqs.question: Is Manglik Dosha checked from Lagna or Moon?
faqs.answer: Traditionally, it's checked from Lagna, Moon, and Venus. Our tool analyzes Mars from both Lagna and Moon for a comprehensive assessment, showing exact house positions and cancellation factors.

educational.title: What is Manglik Dosha?
content: Manglik Dosha (also called Mangal Dosha, Kuja Dosha, or Mars Affliction) is a condition in Vedic astrology where Mars is positioned in the 1st, 2nd, 4th, 7th, 8th, or 12th house from your Lagna (Ascendant), Moon, or Venus. It's primarily considered for marriage compatibility.

Mars represents energy, aggression, and passion. When placed in houses related to marriage and relationships (especially 7th house), it can bring intensity, conflicts, or delays in marital happiness‚Äîunless there are cancellation factors in the chart.
Enter your birth details above to check if you have Manglik Dosha, its severity, cancellation factors, and personalized remedies.

faqs.question: What is Kalsarp Dosha?
faqs.answer: Kalsarp Dosha occurs when all seven planets (Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn) are positioned between Rahu and Ketu in a birth chart. This creates a serpent-like pattern and is believed to bring various challenges in life.

faqs.question: Are all types of Kalsarp Dosha equally severe?
faqs.answer: No, there are 12 types of Kalsarp Dosha based on Rahu's house position, each with varying intensity. Some types like Anant and Takshak are considered more severe, while Sheshnag and Vishdhar are milder. The effects also depend on planetary strengths in your chart.

faqs.question: What is the best remedy for Kalsarp Dosha?
faqs.answer: The most effective remedy is performing Kalsarp Shanti Puja at Trimbakeshwar (Nasik) or any Shiva temple. Additionally, regular Rahu-Ketu mantra chanting, Nag Panchami worship, and offering silver snake statues help pacify the dosha. Always consult a qualified astrologer for personalized remedies.

faqs.question: What are the 12 types of Kalsarp Dosha?
faqs.answer: The 12 types are named after serpents: Anant, Kulik, Vasuki, Shankhpal, Padma, Mahapadma, Takshak, Karkotak, Shankhachur, Ghatak, Vishdhar, and Sheshnag. Each type has Rahu in a different house (1st through 12th) and affects specific life areas.

faqs.question: Does Kalsarp Dosha affect everyone equally?
faqs.answer: No, the effects depend on the specific type, planetary strengths, aspects on Rahu-Ketu, and whether it's 'Ascending' (Rahu ahead) or 'Descending' (Ketu ahead) Kalsarp. Spiritual-minded individuals may even benefit from this yoga.

faqs.question: Can Kalsarp Dosha be completely removed?
faqs.answer: Kalsarp Dosha cannot be removed from the birth chart, but its negative effects can be significantly reduced through remedies, worship, and spiritual practices. The dosha also naturally reduces after age 45 for many people.

educational.title: What is Kaal Sarp Dosha?
content: Kaal Sarp Dosha (also spelled Kalsarp) is a condition in Vedic astrology where all seven planets (Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn) are hemmed between the shadow planets Rahu and Ketu. This creates a serpent-like pattern in the birth chart.

There are 12 types of Kalsarp Dosha based on Rahu's house position, each affecting different life areas. While traditionally considered challenging, modern astrologers note that many successful people have this yoga‚Äîit often indicates a powerful but destiny-driven life path.
Enter your birth details above to check if you have Kalsarp Dosha, its type, severity, and specific remedies.

faqs.question: What is Pitra Dosha?
faqs.answer: Pitra Dosha is an astrological affliction indicating unresolved ancestral karma or debts. It occurs when the Sun (representing father and ancestors) is afflicted by malefic planets like Rahu, Ketu, or Saturn, or when the 9th house (house of father and fortune) is negatively impacted.

faqs.question: What are the signs of Pitra Dosha in life?
faqs.answer: Common signs include unexplained obstacles in career despite hard work, problems in having children, chronic health issues, financial instability, repeated nightmares about deceased relatives, family conflicts, and a general feeling of being cursed or unlucky.

faqs.question: How can Pitra Dosha be remedied?
faqs.answer: Key remedies include performing Shradh ceremonies during Pitru Paksha, Pind Daan at Gaya, daily Tarpan offerings, Narayan Bali Puja, feeding crows and Brahmins, donating to cow welfare, and planting Peepal trees. These should ideally be performed under guidance of a knowledgeable priest.

faqs.question: When is the best time to perform Pitra Dosha remedies?
faqs.answer: Pitru Paksha (the 16-day period in the Hindu month of Ashwin, usually September-October) is the most auspicious time. Additionally, Amavasya (new moon) days, the anniversary of ancestors' death (Shraddha), and solar/lunar eclipses are considered powerful times for ancestral rituals.

faqs.question: How is Pitra Dosha detected in a birth chart?
faqs.answer: Astrologers look for: Sun afflicted by Rahu/Ketu, malefics in the 9th house, 9th lord placed in 6th/8th/12th, Sun-Saturn conjunction, Rahu in 9th house, and weak/debilitated Sun. Multiple indicators increase the severity.

faqs.question: Can Pitra Dosha be completely removed?
faqs.answer: While the affliction in the birth chart remains, its negative effects can be significantly reduced through sincere remedies and ancestral propitiation. Regular Shradh ceremonies and good karma help pacify ancestral souls and reduce suffering.

educational.title: What is Pitra Dosha?
content: Pitra Dosha (also spelled Pitru Dosha) is a karmic condition in Vedic astrology indicating unresolved debts or unfulfilled duties toward ancestors. The word 'Pitra' means ancestors/forefathers, and 'Dosha' means affliction or fault.

This dosha is detected by analyzing the Sun (karaka for father), the 9th house (house of father, fortune, and dharma), and their afflictions by malefic planets‚Äîespecially Rahu, Ketu, and Saturn. It's believed to cause obstacles in various life areas as ancestral karma manifesting in the current generation.
Enter your birth details above to check for Pitra Dosha indicators in your chart and receive personalized remedies.

faqs.question: What is Ashtakoot Gun Milan?
faqs.answer: Ashtakoot Gun Milan is a Vedic astrology method to assess marriage compatibility by comparing 8 aspects (kootas) of the couple's horoscopes. It provides a score out of 36 points based on Varna, Vashya, Tara, Yoni, Graha Maitri, Gana, Bhakoot, and Nadi.

faqs.question: How many points are required for a good match?
faqs.answer: Generally, 18+ points is considered acceptable, 25+ points is a good match, and 32+ points is an excellent match. However, the presence of major doshas like Nadi Dosha or Bhakoot Dosha can significantly impact compatibility regardless of total score.

faqs.question: What is Nadi Dosha and why is it important?
faqs.answer: Nadi Dosha occurs when both partners have the same Nadi (Adi, Madhya, or Antya). It is considered serious as it may affect health and progeny. Remedies like Nadi Dosha Nivaran Puja are recommended before proceeding with marriage.

faqs.question: What are the 8 Kootas (aspects) in Kundali matching?
faqs.answer: The 8 Kootas are: Varna (spiritual compatibility, 1 point), Vashya (mutual attraction, 2 points), Tara (birth star compatibility, 3 points), Yoni (physical/sexual compatibility, 4 points), Graha Maitri (mental compatibility, 5 points), Gana (temperament, 6 points), Bhakoot (health/wealth, 7 points), and Nadi (genetic compatibility, 8 points).

faqs.question: Can a low-score match still work?
faqs.answer: Yes, many factors beyond Gun Milan affect marital success. If major doshas (Nadi, Bhakoot) are absent and individual charts show good 7th house strength, even a score of 18-24 can work well. Modern astrologers also consider Manglik status and planetary strengths.

faqs.question: Is exact birth time necessary for Kundali matching?
faqs.answer: Yes, accurate birth time is crucial as it determines the Moon sign and Nakshatra (birth star), which form the basis of all 8 Kootas. Even a 15-minute difference can change the Nakshatra and affect the matching score.

educational.title: What is Kundali Milan?
content: Kundali Milan (also called Gun Milan or Ashtakoot Matching) is the traditional Vedic astrology method for assessing marriage compatibility. It compares the Moon signs and Nakshatras (birth stars) of the prospective bride and groom across 8 different aspects called Kootas.

The system assigns points to each Koota, totaling 36 points maximum. A higher score indicates better compatibility, though the presence or absence of specific doshas (like Nadi Dosha or Bhakoot Dosha) often matters more than the total score.
Enter both partners' birth details above to get your complete Ashtakoot analysis with detailed breakdown and compatibility verdict.

faqs.question: What is the correct finger for wearing gemstones?
faqs.answer: Each gemstone relates to a specific planet and finger (e.g., Ruby on ring finger, Yellow Sapphire on index finger).

educational.title: What is Gemstone Recommendation?

The right gemstone strengthens weak benefic planets or supports strong planets in your chart. Wearing the wrong gemstone can amplify negative energies, which is why birth chart analysis is essential before wearing any ratna.

faqs.question: Does my birth chart indicate fame in my profession?
faqs.answer: Certain 'Raj Yogas' and angular planet placements can indicate high status and fame in your chosen field.

educational.title: What is Career Prediction?
content: Career prediction in Vedic astrology primarily analyzes the 10th house (house of profession, karma, and public status), its lord, and the planets influencing it. The 6th house (service/employment) and 7th house (business/partnerships) are also examined.

Key indicators include: the 10th lord's placement and strength, planets in the 10th house, aspects on the 10th house, and the Dasha periods of career-related planets. Saturn indicates discipline-based careers, Mercury favors communication/trade, Jupiter suits teaching/advisory roles.
Enter your birth details above to discover your ideal career path, job vs business inclination, and favorable periods for professional growth.

faqs.question: What is the best direction for bedroom as per Vastu?
faqs.answer: The Southwest direction is ideal for the master bedroom as it promotes stability and restful sleep. South and West are also good options. Avoid placing the master bedroom in the Northeast as it can cause health issues.

faqs.question: Where should the kitchen be located according to Vastu?
faqs.answer: The Southeast corner (Agneya) is the ideal location for the kitchen as it's governed by the Fire element (Agni). The cooking platform should be placed so you face East while cooking. Avoid placing the kitchen in the Northeast.

faqs.question: What is the ideal Vastu for a home office?
faqs.answer: North or East-facing desks are ideal for concentration and success. The West direction also works well. Sit facing North or East while working. Avoid sitting with your back to the door, and keep the Southwest corner of the room free from electronics.

faqs.question: How can I fix Vastu defects without renovation?
faqs.answer: Simple remedies include: placing mirrors to expand cramped spaces, using colors associated with missing elements, installing brass pyramids or Vastu yantras, adding plants to enhance positive energy, and using curtains/partitions to redirect energy flow.

faqs.question: Is Vastu Shastra scientifically valid?
faqs.answer: Vastu Shastra is based on principles of architecture, geometry, and directional energies developed over thousands of years. While not a modern science, many of its principles align with good design practices regarding light, ventilation, and spatial psychology.

faqs.question: What role do colors play in Vastu?
faqs.answer: Colors affect room energy: Green for East (health), Blue for North (career), Red/Orange for South (fame), Yellow for Southwest (relationships). Bedrooms benefit from soft pastel colors, while kitchens can have warm colors. Avoid dark colors in Northeast corners.

educational.title: What is Room Vastu?
content: Vastu Shastra (literally 'science of architecture') is the ancient Indian system of design and spatial arrangement. It aims to harmonize buildings with natural forces and cosmic energies by aligning rooms and elements with cardinal directions.

Each direction in Vastu is governed by a specific element and deity: Northeast by Water, Southeast by Fire, Southwest by Earth, Northwest by Air, and Center by Space. Proper room placement harnesses these energies for health, prosperity, and harmony.
Select a room type above to get specific Vastu recommendations for placement, furniture arrangement, colors, and simple remedies.

faqs.question: Which house numbers are lucky in numerology?
faqs.answer: Numbers 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, and 9 are generally considered lucky. Number 1 brings leadership, 2 harmony, 3 creativity, 5 change and growth, 6 love and family, and 9 completion and wisdom. However, compatibility with your personal numbers matters most.

faqs.question: Is house number 4 unlucky?
faqs.answer: Number 4 is often considered challenging as it represents hard work and limitations. However, it provides stability and is excellent for building foundations. If your Life Path is 4 or 8, a number 4 house can actually be very supportive.

faqs.question: How do I calculate my house number in numerology?
faqs.answer: Add all digits of your house/flat number until you get a single digit (1-9). For example, house 234 = 2+3+4 = 9. For addresses with letters like '12A', assign number values to letters (A=1, B=2, etc.) and add them.

faqs.question: What if my house number doesn't match my Life Path?
faqs.answer: You can use simple remedies: adding a number to your nameplate or door to change the vibration, using the house's color scheme to balance energies, or placing specific crystals and plants associated with harmonizing numbers.

faqs.question: Does flat number or building number matter more?
faqs.answer: Your specific flat/unit number has the most direct influence on your living space. However, the building number and even street number create layers of influence. Start by harmonizing your flat number, then consider other levels.

faqs.question: Can I change my house number's energy without moving?
faqs.answer: Yes! Add a brass number plate with a harmonious digit inside your home, use colors and decor associated with balancing numbers, place specific plants (like bamboo for 4, money plant for 8), and keep the entrance well-lit and clutter-free.

educational.title: What is House Number Numerology?
content: House Number Numerology combines Vastu Shastra principles with numerical vibrations to assess whether a home's energy is compatible with its residents. Every number carries a specific vibration that influences the experiences of people living there.

The house number is reduced to a single digit (1-9) or master number (11, 22) and analyzed for its inherent qualities. This is then compared with the residents' Life Path numbers to determine compatibility and suggest remedies if needed.
Enter your house/flat number and birth date above to check compatibility and receive personalized Vastu and numerology recommendations.

faqs.question: What is a Muhurat?
faqs.answer: Muhurat (also spelled Muhurta) is a unit of time in Vedic astrology, approximately 48 minutes long. In common usage, it refers to an auspicious time period for starting important activities like business, travel, ceremonies, or construction.

faqs.question: What is Panchang?
faqs.answer: Panchang means 'five limbs' and refers to the five elements of Hindu calendar: Tithi (lunar day), Nakshatra (lunar mansion), Yoga (luni-solar combination), Karana (half-tithi), and Vara (weekday). All five elements are analyzed to determine auspicious times.

faqs.question: What is Raahu Kaal?
faqs.answer: Raahu Kaal is an inauspicious period of approximately 1.5 hours each day ruled by the shadow planet Rahu. It's generally avoided for starting new ventures, though it varies by weekday and location.

faqs.question: What is Abhijit Muhurat?
faqs.answer: Abhijit Muhurat is the most auspicious 48-minute window around solar noon each day. It's considered powerful enough to overcome most doshas and is ideal for starting important activities.

faqs.question: How accurate are these calculations?
faqs.answer: Our calculations use precise astronomical formulas for planetary positions and follow traditional Vedic Panchang rules. Results are location-specific based on actual sunrise/sunset times for your city.

faqs.question: Which activities need Muhurat and which don't?
faqs.answer: Important life events benefit from Muhurat: starting a business, buying property/vehicle, marriage, griha pravesh, starting education, surgery dates. Daily activities like regular shopping or travel don't require Muhurat selection.

educational.title: What is Shubh Muhurat?
content: Shubh Muhurat (auspicious time) is the practice of selecting favorable moments for important activities based on Vedic Panchang. The concept is rooted in the belief that cosmic energies vary throughout the day and certain times are more conducive to success.

The Panchang analyzes five elements: Tithi (lunar day), Nakshatra (birth star), Yoga (planetary combination), Karana (half-tithi), and Vara (weekday). Additionally, inauspicious periods like Raahu Kaal and Yamaganda are avoided.
Select your city and purpose above to find the best dates and times for your important activities based on complete Panchang analysis.

info.title: About Bhagyodaya (Rise of Fortune)
info.description: Bhagyodaya (‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡§Ø) is a Sanskrit term meaning 'Rise of Fortune' or 'Dawn of Luck'. In Vedic numerology, it refers to specific years in your life when cosmic energies align to support your success and prosperity.
info.whatIsDescription: Your Bhagyodaya Year is calculated by combining your Birth Day Number with your Life Path Number. This reveals the age at which your fortune is destined to peak. Multiple fortune years occur throughout life, with varying intensities based on personal year cycles, planetary returns, and pinnacle phases.
info.howItWorksDescription: We analyze your birth date to determine Life Path, Birth Day, and (optionally) Destiny numbers. The primary Bhagyodaya age is the sum of Birth Day and Life Path numbers. We also calculate Pinnacle cycles, Challenge cycles, Saturn Returns (age 29, 58), Jupiter cycles (every 12 years), and Personal Year patterns to give you a comprehensive fortune map.
info.component1: Primary Bhagyodaya Age - Your main fortune peak year
info.component2: Pinnacle Cycles - Four major life phases with unique opportunities
info.component3: Challenge Cycles - Karmic lessons and how to overcome them
info.component4: Saturn Returns - Major life restructuring periods (ages 29, 58)
info.component5: Jupiter Cycles - Expansion and luck periods every 12 years

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: What if I've already passed my Bhagyodaya Year?
faq.a1: Don't worry! Your primary Bhagyodaya is just the first major fortune peak. Life has multiple fortune years at different intensities. Check the Fortune Years tab to see upcoming peaks. Each 9-year cycle brings new opportunities aligned with your personal year number.
faq.a2: The calculations are based on traditional Vedic numerology formulas. While numerology provides valuable guidance, it should be used alongside practical planning. Think of fortune years as times when cosmic support is stronger - but action is still required to manifest results.
faq.a3: Pinnacles are four major life phases, each with a specific theme and opportunities. They're calculated from your birth date and Life Path Number. Challenges run parallel to Pinnacles and represent karmic lessons you must learn during each phase. Mastering your current challenge accelerates your growth.
faq.q4: How should I prepare for my Bhagyodaya Year?
faq.a4: Build skills and resources in the years leading up to your fortune peak. Clear karmic debts, strengthen relationships, and position yourself for opportunities. During the Bhagyodaya year itself, take bold action, start new ventures, and make major decisions you've been postponing.

Many families find that numerologically compatible names feel more natural and create positive energy. The name is a lifelong gift - choosing one with care adds an extra layer of intention.
faq.q2: Can I use a name that's not in the suggestions?

faq.q3: What if parents have incompatible numbers?

faq.q4: Should the starting letter match specific numbers?

info.title: About House Number Vastu
info.description: In Vastu Shastra and numerology, your house number carries specific vibrations that influence the energy of your home. Each number from 1-9 has unique characteristics, planetary rulers, and effects on the residents.
info.howItWorksDescription: We reduce your house number to a single digit (1-9) by adding all digits together. Letters in addresses (like 12A) are converted to their numerical values. The final number reveals the dominant energy of your home and its compatibility with residents.
info.number1: 1 (Sun) - Leadership, independence, new beginnings. Best for entrepreneurs.
info.number2: 2 (Moon) - Harmony, partnership, emotional balance. Ideal for couples.
info.number3: 3 (Jupiter) - Creativity, joy, social energy. Great for families with children.
info.number4: 4 (Rahu) - Stability but challenging. Requires remedies for best results.
info.number5: 5 (Mercury) - Change, communication, adventure. Suits dynamic households.
info.number6: 6 (Venus) - Love, family, beauty. Perfect for nurturers and artists.
info.number7: 7 (Ketu) - Spirituality, introspection. Best for seekers and researchers.
info.number8: 8 (Saturn) - Power and karma. Can bring success with proper discipline.
info.number9: 9 (Mars) - Courage, completion, high energy. Good for athletes and helpers.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: How do I calculate my house number?
faq.a1: Add all digits of your house/flat number together until you get a single digit (1-9). For example, flat 42 = 4+2 = 6. For 12A, convert A=1, so 1+2+1 = 4. Our calculator does this automatically.
faq.q2: What if my house number is 'challenging'?
faq.a2: Numbers 4 and 8 are considered challenging but not bad. They require more effort and proper Vastu remedies. You can also add elements to your address (like using 4/1 instead of 4) to shift the energy.
faq.q3: Should I change my house because of the number?
faq.a3: Not necessarily. Vastu remedies can significantly improve the energy of any number. Focus on the remedies provided - adding specific colors, symbols, or items in certain directions can balance challenging numbers.
faq.a4: Yes, when your Life Path Number harmonizes with your house number, you experience less friction and more natural flow. If incompatible, simple remedies and awareness can help you work with the energy rather than against it.

info.title: About Vastu Room Placement
info.description: Vastu Shastra provides guidelines for optimal room placement in a home. Each direction has specific energy characteristics that make it suitable for certain activities. By aligning rooms with their ideal directions, you create harmony and positive energy flow.
info.directionsDescription: Each direction is governed by a deity and element. North-East (Ishaan) is the most sacred, governed by water. South-East (Agneya) belongs to fire. South-West (Nairitya) is earth element and ideal for heavy items. North-West (Vayavya) represents air element.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: What if my room is in the wrong direction?
faq.a1: Don't worry! Vastu provides remedies for every situation. Using appropriate colors, placement of items, and specific remedies can significantly balance the energy. Our tool provides customized remedies based on your room's current direction.
faq.q2: Which room direction is most important?
faq.a2: The master bedroom (South-West) and main entrance (North/East/North-East) are considered most important. Pooja room in North-East and kitchen in South-East also significantly impact the home's energy.
faq.q3: Can I make changes without major renovation?
faq.a3: Absolutely! Simple changes like furniture rearrangement, color adjustments, adding plants, using mirrors strategically, and placing Vastu items can make significant improvements without construction.
faq.q4: How do I find the direction of my room?
faq.a4: Use a compass app on your phone. Stand in the center of your room and note which direction each wall faces. The direction your room 'opens to' (main window/door) typically determines its orientation.
